meanings.definition: To reserve or arrange in advance.
meanings.sent1: She prebooks her flights to ensure she gets the best seats.
meanings.sent2: He always prebooks his hotel rooms before going on vacation.
meanings.sent3: The organized student prebooks all his study sessions for the semester.
meanings.sent4: Planning ahead, she prebooks all her appointments for the month.
meanings.sent5: To avoid any last-minute rush, it is wise to prebooks your tickets early.

meanings.definition: The act of reserving or arranging in advance.
meanings.sent1: The prebooks for the event are filling up quickly.
meanings.sent2: She made her prebooks for the conference well in advance.
meanings.sent3: The prebooks for the movie night are selling like hotcakes.
meanings.sent4: The prebooks for the new book release exceeded all expectations.
meanings.sent5: Make sure to check the prebooks for available slots before planning your visit.
